lead_paragraph: Three research groups, working independently of one another, reported in the journal Science on Thursday that a powerful new gene-editing technique could treat Duchenne muscular dystrophy in mice.

headline.print_headline: Gene Editing Offers Hope for Severe Form of Muscular Dystrophy
headline.main: Gene Editing Offers Hope for Treating Duchenne Muscular Dystrophy, Studies Find

snippet: Three research groups, working independently of one another, reported in the journal Science on Thursday that a powerful new gene-editing technique could treat Duchenne muscular dystrophy in mice.
abstract: Three research groups, reporting in journal Science, describe using new gene-editing technique Crispr-Cas9 to treat mice with defective dystrophin gene; research marks important step toward potential treatment for Duchenne muscular dystrophy; remains unclear how human immune system would react to therapy.
